Mobile Information Needs

Mobile information needs can be assed by two criteria: scope and type. Scope describes the sophistication of the information need, the degree of higher-level thinking it involves, and the time commitment required to satisfy it. The lookup, learn, and investigate elements of scope are derived from Gary Marchioniniâ€™s work on exploratory search, while the casual component has been more recently advocated by Max Wilson and others.
